title: Learning Path: packaging error
ai_summary: The user is encountering a generic packaging error in Unreal Engine 5, preventing them from creating a distributable build of their project.
ai_what_you_learn: Enable 'Detailed Packaging Logs' in Project Settings -> Packaging to get specific error messages.
Check the Output Log window (Window -> Developer Tools -> Output Log) for red error messages during packaging.
Ensure all plugins used in your project are enabled and compatible with the target platform.
Verify that all assets referenced in your levels and blueprints exist and are properly loaded.

steps.title: Step 1: Understand the Packaging Process
steps.description:
Understanding the basics of packaging will help you identify where the error might be occurring. This video will cover the essential steps and settings involved in preparing your project for distribution.

👉 **Action:** Watch the first 10 minutes of the 'Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine' video to get a general overview of the packaging process.
steps.action: Watch the first 10 minutes of the 'Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine' video to get a general overview of the packaging process.

content.title: Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine
content.description:
**Why this helps:** This video provides a foundational understanding of the packaging process in Unreal Engine, covering essential settings and steps.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Start at the beginning and watch until ~10:00 to understand the basic workflow. (10 minutes)

steps.title: Step 2: Diagnose Your Issue
steps.description:
The key to fixing a packaging error is understanding the specific error message. Enabling detailed logs will provide more information. This involves checking the output log for specific errors.

👉 **Action:** Enable Detailed Packaging Logs in your Project Settings (Packaging section). Then, try packaging again and carefully examine the Output Log window for any red error messages.
steps.action: Enable Detailed Packaging Logs in your Project Settings (Packaging section). Then, try packaging again and carefully examine the Output Log window for any red error messages.

content.title: Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine
content.description:
**Why this helps:** Although the video does not go into detail on packaging errors, the video does cover the basics of the packaging process. This can help you understand where to look for errors.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Scan through the video to find where the Packaging settings are (~10:00 onward) and look for the 'Detailed Packaging Logs' setting. (5 minutes)

steps.title: Step 3: Apply the Fix
steps.description:
Once you have a specific error message, you can start troubleshooting. Common issues include missing assets, plugin incompatibility, or incorrect project settings. The other videos, while not directly about packaging errors, might indirectly point to sources of errors (e.g., plugin issues).

👉 **Action:** Based on the specific error message in the Output Log, search online forums (e.g., Unreal Engine forums, AnswerHub) for solutions related to that error. If the error relates to a specific plugin, check its documentation or contact the plugin creator.
steps.action: Based on the specific error message in the Output Log, search online forums (e.g., Unreal Engine forums, AnswerHub) for solutions related to that error. If the error relates to a specific plugin, check its documentation or contact the plugin creator.

content.title: Plugin-afying Lyra: Shipping a Game on the UE5 Lyra Framework | Unreal Fest 2024
content.description:
**Why this helps:** If your project utilizes plugins, this video can help identify potential issues related to plugin compatibility or configuration that might cause packaging errors.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Watch the video and note down their process of using plugins and how they ensure they are correctly packaged. (Watch the whole video)

steps.title: Step 4: Prevent Future Issues
steps.description:
Implementing good project management practices can help prevent packaging errors in the future. This includes regularly testing your builds, keeping your assets organized, and carefully managing your plugins.

👉 **Action:** Before making significant changes to your project, create a backup or use version control (e.g., Git). Regularly package your project throughout development to catch errors early. Keep your Unreal Engine version and plugins up to date.
steps.action: Before making significant changes to your project, create a backup or use version control (e.g., Git). Regularly package your project throughout development to catch errors early. Keep your Unreal Engine version and plugins up to date.

content.title: Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine
content.description:
**Why this helps:** While not directly about prevention, understanding the packaging process itself (as covered in this video) is the first step towards preventing errors. Knowing the steps involved allows you to anticipate potential problems.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Revisit the video to reinforce your understanding of the entire packaging workflow. (Review the whole video again)
